sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with noisy data
message_1:
Consider the following system of 3 linear equations with noisy data:

2x + y - 3z = 9.5
x - 4y + z = -7.2
5x + 7y - 2.5z = 24.3

Find the solution to the system of equations using Gaussian elimination method with partial pivoting.
message_2:
To solve the system of equations using Gaussian elimination with partial pivoting, we first write the augmented matrix:

|  2   1  -3  |  9.5  |
|  1  -4   1  | -7.2  |
|  5   7 -2.5 | 24.3  |

Step 1: Find the pivot in the first column. The pivot is the element with the largest absolute value. In this case, it's 5 (in the third row). So, we swap the first and third rows:

|  5   7  -2.5 | 24.3  |
|  1  -4   1  | -7.2  |
|  2   1  -3  |  9.5  |

Step 2: Eliminate the first column below the pivot. To do this, we perform the following row operations:

R2 = R2 - (1/5)R1
R3 = R3 - (2/5)R1

The new augmented matrix becomes:

|  5    7   -2.5 |  24.3  |
|  0  -5.4  1.5  | -11.86 |
|  0   -2.4 -2.1 |  -3.86 |

Step 3: Find the pivot in the second column. The pivot is the element with the largest absolute value in the second column below the first row. In this case, it's -5.4 (in the second row). So, we don't need to swap any rows.

Step 4: Eliminate the second column below the pivot. To do this, we perform the following row operation:

R3 = R3 - (-2.4/-5.4)R2

The new augmented matrix becomes:

|  5    7   -2.5 |  24.3   |
|  0  -5.4  1.5  | -11.86  |
|  0    0  -0.8  |  -1.6   |

Step 5: Now we have an upper triangular matrix, and we can use back-substitution to find the solution.

From the third row, we have -0.8z = -1.6, so z = 2.

From the second row, we have -5.4y + 1.5(2) = -11.86, so y = 1.

From the first row, we have 5x + 7(1) - 2.5(2) = 24.3, so x = 2.

So, the solution to the system of equations is x = 2, y = 1, and z = 2.
